data.question: What are the colors of the two polymorphs of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 identified in the study?
data.answer: One is green and one is blue.

data.question: What changes in the visible spectrum are attributed to the vapochromic behavior of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: The visible color changes and also by large IR changes in the νCN region.

data.question: What facilitates reversible solvent exchange in Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: The network-stabilizing gold−gold interactions and the flexible coordination sphere of CuII.

data.question: What is the result of exposing Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs to ambient water vapor at room temperature?
data.answer: They convert to the same Cu[Au(CN)2]2(H2O)2 complex.

data.question: What is the coordination geometry of the CuII center in polymorph 1 of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2?
data.answer: The CuII center in polymorph 1 has a five-coordinate geometry.

data.question: Is the vapochromic behavior of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs identical despite their different solid-state structures?
data.answer: True

data.question: Do Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs exhibit luminescence?
data.answer: False

data.question: What happens when DMSO vapor is added back to Cu[Au(CN)2]2(H2O)2?
data.answer: It converts exclusively to the green polymorph Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2.

data.question: What is the role of [Au(CN)2]- in the vapochromic behavior of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: It provides a sensitive CN reporter group and helps increase the structural dimensionality of the system.

data.question: Can the Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system differentiate VOCs through IR spectroscopy?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of solvent exchange on the IR spectrum of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: Each solvent complex can be distinguished by its unique νCN region in the IR spectrum.

data.question: Does the concentration of starting reagents affect the formation of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the thermal stability difference between the two polymorphs of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2?
data.answer: The thermal stabilities with respect to the loss of the first DMSO molecules are significantly different.

data.question: What is the coordination geometry of the CuII center in polymorph 2 of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2?
data.answer: The CuII center in polymorph 2 has a six-coordinate geometry.

data.question: Are the magnetic properties of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs similar?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of gold−gold interactions in Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: They help stabilize the 3-D network as solvent exchange takes place.

data.question: Can Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs sense different donor solvents?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of Jahn−Teller distortions in Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: It likely increases the flexibility of the framework by allowing the breaking and reformation of Cu−N(cyano) bonds.

data.question: Is the formation of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs concentration-dependent?
data.answer: True

data.question: Do Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs exhibit different visible reflectance maxima?
data.answer: True
